occupation: CTO & Co-Founder at Strive Math (YC S21)
headline: Co-Founder at Strive Math (YC S21) - Hiring!
summary: My life's mission is to empower people through the use of education, technology and entrepreneurship. I bring ideas into reality through the use of software and engineering. I plan to use this talent to disrupt the education sector to make education more accessible, affordable and meaningful.

experiences.title: Venture Partner
experiences.description:
In the real world when math is done by engineers or financial analysts they use computers and code yet in school students are still calculating by hand. Coding is the literacy of the 21st century and Strive is creating the content and platform to make math more joyful and actually applicable to the real world.

Strive Math (YC S21) is a 1:1 tutoring service for 6–10th graders that teaches math through coding games and visualizations. For example, when students create the game "Pong", they bring algebra and geometry to life by determining how fast the ball moves and at what angle. They also learn coding at the same time.

Our vision is to replace STEM education in schools and universities globally through our unique pedagogy.  Math, physics, biology and economics can all and should all be taught through code because that's how they are actually applied in industry.

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.description: Entrepreneur First is the world’s leading talent investor. It invests time and money in the world’s most talented and ambitious individuals, helping them to find a co-founder, develop an idea, and start a company. So far, EF helped 2,000+ people create 300+ companies, worth a combined $2bn.

experiences.title: Co-Founder
experiences.description: Quillo is South Africa's largest second-hand textbook marketplace. While pursuing a full-time degree in electrical and computer engineering at the University of Cape Town, I scaled the platform to more than 32 000 students across 24 different universities in South Africa. Quillo won the reward of 'Best Student Startup' in South Africa in 2019 (Awarded by Global Startup Awards). Quillo has received more than $40K worth of support from two incubators, MTN Solution Space and Injini - Africa's Edtech Incubator. In the space of two years, the platform has transacted more than $65K in textbook value and has saved students $130K on textbooks. I was responsible for product development, design, marketing and business strategy. I led a team of four developers, two sales representatives and 18 brand ambassadors.

experiences.title: Founder in Residence (EFSG8)
experiences.description:
Our urgent mission is to make it easy to buy and sell PPE in Africa so that frontline workers can get the vital protection they need. We enable suppliers to find a market of reliable, vetted buyers. We enable buyers to find products and suppliers quickly and efficiently.
We’re an efficient marketplace, which:
1. Reduces stock-outs and lead times. Buyers and suppliers are connected in a reliable and convenient way
2. Creates trust. We take steps to vet both buyers and suppliers and educate around the certification to look for. 
3. Keeps prices reasonable. We enable easy searches and comparisons.
Our PPE marketplace will grow into a platform for wholesale trade in Africa. We believe in the power of enabling African manufacturers to find markets locally, on the African continent, and internationally.

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.description:
Coronapp https://www.coronapp.co.za/ is a centralised repository for relevant and accurate information regarding the COVID-19 virus in South Africa. Its purpose is to make reliable information highly accessible to South Africans in a hope to help people and prevent panic.

Coronapp serves 1000s of South African daily seeking reliable up to date information about the coronavirus. Since the platform's inception it has received more than 1.5M website hits.
experiences.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

experiences.company: South African Union of Jewish Students (SAUJS)
experiences.title: Chief Political Officer and Events Co-ordinator
experiences.description: I served two terms part of the executive of the South African Union of Jewish Students, the primary body that represents Jewish students on university campuses. I presented to the academic freedom committee of UCT a distinguished group of the top professors, lecturers and academics in the country. I was responsible for strategising and presenting a case against the proposed academic boycott of Israel. I played a crucial role in organising our political strategy and being a spokesperson for the organisation. This opportunity allowed me to cultivate my leadership skills as well as begin grappling with solving broader political and social issues.

education.field_of_study: BSc Eng in Electrical & Computer Engineering
education.description:
Graduated with first-class honours
Top student of 2016 Engineering Physics (400+ students)

Matriculated with 9 distinctions 
Achieved within the top 1% for English in South Africa

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Represented South Africa at ESDC Debating Championship
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: I represented South Africa in debating at the Eurasian Schools Debating Championship. I was team captain and led my team to the finals of the competition where we placed second to the then best team in the world.  Amongst a pool of over 150 world-class international speakers, I came ranked as the 8th best speaker at the tournament. I won various other debating competitions throughout my high school career and consistently came ranked amongst the top 10 individual speakers.

volunteer_work.title: Camp Counselor
volunteer_work.description:
Camp counsellor for two years.  My role was to facilitate and educate Jewish youth across South Africa for four weeks on a camp that happens every December. Our primary goal was to teach critical thinking while creating an unforgettable experience. 

I was responsible for coordinating and planning activities for over 150 kids and 24 councillors. I hand to create fun and enjoyable experiences while ensuring these experiences were educational. It was during this time where I discovered that education and empowering people was amongst one of my foremost passions.

volunteer_work.title: Mentor
volunteer_work.description: I was a mentor for 20 plus teenagers from disadvantaged backgrounds. I was responsible for organising educational activities and looking after the group.

certifications.name: Google Africa Scholarship Mobile Web Specialist Course
